result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony A. Pelot

defendant.name: Pelot, Tony A.
defendant.address: 601 N Main St # 21; Falls View Esta, Fall River, WI 53932

records.addlTxt: 2:10 PM Case called: 21CT74 and 22CM315. Defendant Tony A. Pelot in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Tony A. Pelot.  Attorney Jordan Lippert in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 of 21CT74. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 2 & 3 dismissed. 22CM315 dismissed but read in. Sentencing statements. Court sentencing the defendant to serve 30 days in jail, with Huber. $1492.00 fines and costs. $65.00 blood draw fee. 13 month DL revocation and 13 month IID. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. 7 days credit. Jail start 12/26/22 at 7:00 PM. 2:22 PM

10:31 AM Defendant Tony A. Pelot in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Tony A. Pelot.  Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lawton stated the case is close to a resolution. Defendant has another open case for tomorrow at 2 pm with Judge Cross. This will be set to track with that case. 10:32 AM
Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
filed by Atty Lawton re: discovery
Demand for Discovery filed by Atty Mark Lawton

Right to atty recited, Defendant would like to accept offer, Court in recess at 9:17 A.M., Court back in session at 9:37 A.M., appearances the same, Waiver of Right to Atty filed, Defendant would like to contact counsel, Court in recess at 9:41 A.M., Court back in session at 9:58 A.M., Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender, Defendant requesting court appointed counsel, Court appoints Atty Mark Lawton, at the rate of $100.00 per hour, defendant to reimburse Columbia County at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 10/15/22,
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:20 am.
